page.title: 03 TRAFFIC SURVEY - B4361
page.content: The B4361 is known as the old Ludlow Road.It goes from Ludlow to Leominster.We went on this road on a lovely Monday afternoon to{count} {traffic}travelling between the two towns.It was a perfect day for traffic spotting.This is what we saw - 62 cars , 9 vans, 2 lorries, 0 coaches or buses, 1 bicycle and 5 pedestrians. Of the cars, 19 were red, 7 green, 11 blue, 3 yellow, 1 black, 6 white and 15 were other colours. We stayed by the side of the road for one whole hour. We think that a lot more traffic now uses the A49 which is a{main trunk road connecting South Wales with the North West of England. This road passes through the other side of our Domesday Area. Another group are doing a traffic survey of that road.
